intro: Lippia martiana, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Lippia martiana is also valued as a source of essential oils and is used in some culinary applications.
